conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine if objects A and B have the same acceleration at time t1.
The graph shows velocity vs. time for objects A and B. Object A has a linearly increasing velocity from t1 to t2. Object B has a curve starting at t1, peaking at t2, then decreasing.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, given by the derivative of velocity with respect to time.
Object A's velocity increases linearly from t1 to t2, indicating a constant slope and constant acceleration.
Object B's velocity curve indicates a non-constant rate of change of velocity, meaning acceleration is not constant.
At t1, compare slopes of tangents for both objects. Object A has a constant positive slope, Object B has a positive but different slope.
The slopes (and thus accelerations) of the two objects at t1 are different, so they do not have the same acceleration.
The two objects do not have the same acceleration at time t1.
